title: All-on-4 implants vs All-on-6 implants: Whatâ€™s the Difference?
shortDescription: Dental implants are a significant option for the restoration of your missing teeth. All-on-implants procedures are classified as cutting-edge dental technology in dental prostheses. The technology provides to surgically place titanium All-on-4 or All-on-6 implant systems in a strategic pattern in the jaw bone. This procedure provides more coverage in the jawbone to have replacement teeth cemented.

title: Why All-on-6 implants might be the best option for you
shortDescription:
The full dental implant, aka All-on-6 implant, is one of the ideal procedures for patients with enough bone structure in the jaw. The implant creates a permanent prosthesis by using six dental implants for each bone in the upper and lower jaw.
The All-on-6 procedure provides better support and comfort. The procedure is generally used in patients with a full arch of missing teeth. The dental implant procedure is ideal for a stable, long-term alternative to traditional dental implants or dentures.

title: Sedation Dentistry 101: The Full List
shortDescription:
In our lifetime, we might see a dentist for treatment, prosthetics, or maintaining the oral cavity. However, the patient tends to be anxious about methods that involve tooth extraction, drilling, or cleaning. For such patients, the method of sedation dentistry is adapted.
Sedation dentistry keeps you comfortable throughout the dental procedure. It is one of the most beneficial methods for patients with dental anxiety or patients undergoing extensive treatment.

title: Considering a Tooth Extraction?
shortDescription: Tooth extraction is one of the most common dental procedures for the removal of a decayed or damaged teeth or removing a wisdom tooth. There can be a variety of reasons why you need to consider a tooth extraction procedure. This article reveals precautions to be taken before undergoing a tooth extraction.

title: 6 Tips To Maintain Your Oral Health After 50
shortDescription: Brushing twice daily, flossing and using an antibacterial mouthwash at least once a day is a must for all. But as we hit the 50 mark, darkened and falling teeth, bad breath, dry mouth, root decay, and gum disease can trouble us.

title: 5 things you need to know about sinus lifts
shortDescription: A sinus lift, a low-risk procedure, can aid in the success of dental implant surgery. But before you have one, here are 5 things you should know!

title: A Comprehensive Guide to Correct Your Crooked Teeth
shortDescription: Teeth that aren't precisely aligned are unique and can add character and charm to your smile. However, if you are unhappy with the look of your teeth or if they are creating health or speech problems, you can have them realigned
